confirmed_facts: Fire broke out at approximately 14:50 local time on 26 November 2025 in a highâ€‘rise apartment complex in Tai Po, Hong Kong.
At least 13 people, including one firefighter, died and about 10 others were injured.
The building had 2,400 units and housed roughly 4,800 residents; 7 of 8 blocks were engulfed by the fire.
Bamboo scaffolding used for maintenance work was present and contributed to the fireâ€™s rapid spread.
Firefighters classified the blaze as a levelâ€‘5 (maximum) fire and are conducting ongoing rescue and suppression operations.
No Korean nationals were reported among the casualties.

timeline.event: Fire ignited at ~14:50 in Tai Po highâ€‘rise apartment complex.
At least 13 deaths and ~10 injuries confirmed; 7 of 8 blocks burned.
Fire rated as levelâ€‘5; rescue and suppression operations underway.
No Korean casualties reported by the Korean Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
